Tomato___Late_blight.description: Late blight is a destructive disease of tomatoes, caused by a fungus-like organism. It thrives in cool, moist conditions.
organic_treatment: Remove and destroy affected leaves immediately.
Apply copper-based fungicides as a preventative measure.
Ensure good air circulation around plants.
chemical_treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
Follow the application instructions on the product label carefully.

Tomato___healthy.description: The plant appears to be healthy. Continue good watering and nutrient practices.
organic_treatment: Monitor regularly for signs of pests or disease.
Use organic mulch to retain soil moisture.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Early blight is a common fungal disease that affects potatoes, characterized by small, dark lesions on lower leaves.
organic_treatment: Apply a biofungicide containing Bacillus subtilis.
Rotate crops and remove plant debris after harvest.
chemical_treatment: Use fungicides with active ingredients like azoxystrobin or pyraclostrobin.

Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot causes lesions on leaves and fruit of pepper plants, and is more common in warm, humid weather.
organic_treatment: Apply copper sprays, but be cautious as overuse can harm plants.
Avoid working with plants when they are wet.
chemical_treatment: Apply bactericides containing streptomycin, but be aware of potential resistance.
